TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AccessibilityRecord extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a record in an and contains information about state change of its source .

remarks.para: Represents a record in an and contains information about state change of its source . When a view fires an accessibility event it requests from its parent to dispatch the constructed event. The parent may optionally append a record for itself for providing more context to s. Hence, accessibility services can facilitate additional accessibility records to enhance feedback.
Once the accessibility event containing a record is dispatched the record is made immutable and calling a state mutation method generates an error.
Note: Not all properties are applicable to all accessibility event types. For detailed information please refer to .
For more information about creating and processing AccessibilityRecords, read the Accessibility developer guide.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetSource(class Android.Views.View source) cil managed

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetSource (Android.Views.View root, int virtualDescendantId);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetSource(class Android.Views.View root, int32 virtualDescendantId) cil managed

Docs.param: The root of the virtual subtree.
The id of the virtual descendant.
Docs.summary: Sets the source to be a virtual descendant of the given root.

remarks.para: Sets the source to be a virtual descendant of the given root. If virtualDescendantId equals to the root is set as the source.

A virtual descendant is an imaginary View that is reported as a part of the view hierarchy for accessibility purposes. This enables custom views that draw complex content to report them selves as a tree of virtual views, thus conveying their logical structure.

Docs.summary: Gets the of the event source.

remarks.para: Gets the of the event source.
Note: It is a client responsibility to recycle the received info by calling to avoid creating of multiple instances.

Docs.summary: Gets the text of the event.

remarks.para: Gets the text of the event. The index in the list represents the priority of the text. Specifically, the lower the index the higher the priority.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
